newsitem.title: USA: Kelley Oil sells Louisiana stake.
newsitem.headline: Kelley Oil sells Louisiana stake.

text.p: Kelley Oil & Gas Corp said Thursday Williams Cos Inc has purchased a 50 percent interest in Kelley's 27,000 net acreage position as well as 23 wells and related facilities in the Houma Embayment in Terrebonne Parish, La.

The company said the sale of the south Louisiana interest, effective December 1, reduced its net production in December 1996 by 4.2 million cubic feet per day and year-end proved reserves by 5.0 billion cubic feet equivalent.

The purchase price was $20.5 million, a portion of which is committed under the joint venture to fund the full cost of drilling up to eight exploration prospects to casing point in the area, Kelley Oil said.
Pursuant to the joint venture, the company said, it and Williams have begun an exploratory drilling program, completion of which is expected by the end of 1997.
Kelley Oil also said its capital budget, set at $34 million for 1997, will be supplemented as determined by the success level of the exploratory efforts in south Louisiana.
